title: Best early Black Friday deals 2025: 35+ sales out early

content.raw: Black Friday is a few weeks away, but retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Walmart are already slashing prices on top tech and more.

content.full:
'ZDNET Recommends': What exactly does it mean?
ZDNET's recommendations are based on many hours of testing, research, and comparison shopping. We gather data from the best available sources, including vendor and retailer listings as well as other relevant and independent reviews sites. And we pore over customer reviews to find out what matters to real people who already own and use the products and services weâ€™re assessing.
When you click through from our site to a retailer and buy a product or service, we may earn affiliate commissions. This helps support our work, but does not affect what we cover or how, and it does not affect the price you pay. Neither ZDNET nor the author are compensated for these independent reviews. Indeed, we follow strict guidelines that ensure our editorial content is never influenced by advertisers.
ZDNET's editorial team writes on behalf of you, our reader. Our goal is to deliver the most accurate information and the most knowledgeable advice possible in order to help you make smarter buying decisions on tech gear and a wide array of products and services. Our editors thoroughly review and fact-check every article to ensure that our content meets the highest standards. If we have made an error or published misleading information, we will correct or clarify the article. If you see inaccuracies in our content, please report the mistake via this form.
Best early Black Friday deals 2025: I'm tracking over 30 of my favorite discounts live now
Black Friday and Cyber Monday are a few weeks away, and you can expect hundreds of discounts across nearly every category, including popular tech items like laptops, TVs, gaming consoles, tablets, and more. ZDNET tests top tech all year, so if you're looking to get your holiday shopping done early, we've got the scoop on all the best early offers from Amazon, Walmart, Best Buy, and more.
Also: Black Friday 2025: Everything to know to save (including when sales actually start)
And as ZDNET's deals and shopping editor, I have a keen eye for the best offers on vetted tech, and our team of experts will be keeping track of the best offers that continue to arise before and through Cyber Week 2025. In the meantime, here are the best early Black Friday deals we've found so far.
Best early Black Friday deals
- Current price: $200
- Original price: $249
The new Watch SE 3 was released in September, and it's seeing it's first major discount since. Grabbing it at this price makes it one of the best smartwatch buys on the market.
Also: I compared every Apple Watch in 2025 - here's why I recommend this model the most
- Current price: $120
- Original price: $200
Right now, the Fitbit Versa 4 is $80 off (the best savings since Prime Day), and it comes with a free $20 Amazon credit.
- Current price: $499
- Original price: $799
Google's Pixel 9 remains a solid phone in 2025, offering strong performance and an AI-powered camera system. Right now, it's on sale.
Also: I highly recommend the Pixel 9 phone, and it's nearly 40% off with this early Black Friday deal
- Current price: $169
- Original price: $229
Audio expert Jada Jones highly recommends these Google earbuds, and they've hit a great price.
- Current price: $295
- Original price: $360
The Switch 2 is the newest console available, but the older Switch is equally as fun and also slightly discounted for a limited time.
- Current price: $30

Streamline your viewing experience with Amazon's Fire TV Stick 4K.
- Current price: $269
- Original price: $299
This Ninja machine can make slushies, margaritas, frappes, and more, and it's totally the frozen frenzy you need this holiday season.

- Beats Pill Speaker: $99 (save $30): The popular Beats Pill speaker is back, and it's on sale in select colors.
TV deals
- Current price: $230
- Original price: $400
The Insignia QF Series is a great entry-level smart TV that uses the Fire TV platform to give you access to thousands of movies, shows, and songs. It supports both Dolby Vision HDR and Dolby Atmos virtual surround sound for enhanced picture and audio quality, as well as integrated Alexa features for hands-free voice controls.
- Current price: $2,000
- Original price: $3,500
The Hisense U8QG is an excellent Mini-LED smart TV with a 165Hz refresh rate, making it perfect for everything from live sports to console gaming.
- Current price: $1,400
- Original price: $2,700
The LG C5 OLED is a high-end TV with excellent picture and audio quality, backed up by support for Dolby Vision HDR, Dolby Atmos virtual surround sound, and a 120Hz refresh rate.
Review: Why I recommend the LG C5 OLED over more premium models
- Current price: $2,300
- Original price: $4,500
Samsung's flagship QLED TV offers impressive picture and audio quality that rivals even OLED models, with support for HDR10+ and Dolby Atmos virtual surround sound as well as Samsung's own object tracking sound technology.
Review: This Samsung QLED TV model is the one most people should buy
- Current price: $1,600
- Original price: $1,800
The 65-inch of Samsung's latest Frame TV model is on sale, and a wall mount is included.
Tablet deals
- Current price: $299
- Original price: $349
The iPad 11 is still the latest base model, and our reviewer recommends it as the best iPad for most people.
Review: I've tested every iPad sold by Apple right now - here's the model I recommend most
- Current price: $279
- Original price: $400
If you're a smart home person -- especially someone who uses Google Assistant -- this is the tablet for you, since it comes with a Charging Speaker Dock that doubles as a smart display.
Review: Google Pixel Tablet
It's also a great tablet for those looking for a long-lasting battery life. When it's not in use and is on the dock, it's constantly charged and ready for use.
- Current price: $800
- Original price: $1,000
This Surface Pro is for professionals who want a high-performance machine with a brilliant display. The additional accessories, like the keyboard and pen, make it even more enticing as a tablet that can double as a computer.
Review: Microsoft Surface Pro
- Current price: $435
- Original price: $500
ZDNET reviewer Maria Diaz said that this tablet's performance is well worth its price tag, and that its display experience is impressive.
Review: Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE+
It handles light work like video calls, messaging, and everyday tasks very well. And, just like the Galaxy Tab S10 Ultra, it is IP68-rated for water and dust resistance to better protect your investment against accidental spills.
- Amazon Fire HD 10 Tablet: $70 (save $70): This is a great deal if you've been shopping for a budget-friendly tablet, whether it's for casual consumption or for a child.
- Amazon Kindle Paperwhite 10th Gen, Refurbished: $97 (save $32): Get a popular Kindle Paperwhite for less with this refurbished model.
Laptop deals
- Current price: $999
- Original price: $1,199
The MacBook Air M4 is perfect for home, work, school, and more, and it's $200 off now.

Samsung's Galaxy Book 4 is a stylish 2-in-1 laptop backed up by decent specs. It has a 16-inch AMOLED display, 16GB of RAM, 1TB of storage, and an Intel Core Ultra 7 processor.

The Acer Aspire Go 15 is a solid budget laptop, housing an Intel Core i5-1334U processor, 8GB of DDR4 RAM, and a 256GB SSD. It's perfect as a lightweight work laptop.
- HP OmniBook X Flip 2-in-1 laptop: $920 (save $130): This HP hybrid laptop comes with a 14-inch touchscreen display, an Intel Core processor, 16GB of RAM, and 1TB of storage.
- Lenovo Yoga Book 9i 2-in-1: $1,500 (save $500): Another powerful laptop currently on sale is a Lenovo hybrid laptop. This future-proof touchscreen laptop comes with an option to run two monitors, an Intel Core Ultra 7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and 1TB of SSD storage.
- HP Victus Full HD gaming laptop: $815 (save $85): While it might struggle with the highest-resource games, this gaming laptop is reasonably priced considering its specifications, including a 144Hz refresh rate, an AMD Ryzen 7 processor, 512GB of storage, and Nvidia GeForce RTX 4050 Graphics.
Apple deals
- Current price: $189

- Current price: $170

This is not the best price we've seen for the AirPods Pro 2, but these under $200 AirPods are still highly recommended.
- Current price: $549

The Apple iPad Air follows the iPad Pro as the second-most capable tablet in the iPad lineup. With the new M3 chip, the Air gets about 17% gains in CPU improvements on the benchmark tests we performed. These improvements are most noticeable in better app performance, multitasking, and rendering speeds.
Review: Apple iPad Air (7th generation)
- Current price: $99
- Original price: $129
The Apple Pencil Pro is under $100 again, and it's the best stylus option for the latest iPads.
- Current price: $1,000
- Original price: $1,100
This particular iPad is for power users and the highest of high-end professionals. Its M4 chip consists of a new 10-core GPU, next-generation machine learning accelerators to handle a diverse range of tasks, and ProMotion technology, enabling variable screen refresh rates ranging from 10 to 120Hz.
- Apple Magic Keyboard Folio: $200 (save $49): Designed for the base-model iPad, this attachable keyboard has a built-in trackpad and an adjustable stand.
- Apple Watch Series 10 42mm: $329 (save $70): Last year's Watch Series 10 is still selling for the same $70 off it's been for the last several months, but it's still a great option for wellness tracking for less.
- Apple AirTag 4-Pack: $65 (save $34): The cheapest we've seen this pack sell for is this price, and if you need seamless Bluetooth tracking, this 4-pack is the best value.

- Original price: $700

This 3-in-1 robot vacuum system is a ZDNET reader favorite, and one of the top 10 ZDNET best sellers in the robot vacuum category.
Review: Eufy Omni S1 Pro
- Nespresso Vertuo Pop+ Coffee Maker: $134 (save $46): Make your favorite hot drinks (including espresso) at home for less.

Health and wellness deals

Reviewer Nina Raemont recommends these sleep earbuds for a good night's rest.

Cyber Week FAQs
When is Black Friday?
This year, Black Friday falls on Friday, Nov. 28. Cyber Monday follows shortly after on Monday, Dec. 1.
Are deals really cheaper during Black Friday?
The holiday season, including Black Friday, is generally a great time to scoop up deals on a multitude of products, including flagship tech. While it's true to shop smart you need to be aware of sly tactics like markups and faux discounts, price tracking tools like Keepa and CamelCamelCamel make it easier than ever to ensure you're getting the best deal possible. Black Friday is also an excellent time to save on last year's latest tech, as we've seen dozens of new releases in phones, TVs, laptops, tablets and more over the last 6 months.
Also: Worried about rising tech prices? Try these 5 easy ways to shop smarter right now
How did we choose these early Black Friday deals?
ZDNET only writes about deals we want to buy -- devices and products we desire, need, or would recommend. Our experts looked for deals that were at least 20% off (or are hardly ever on sale), using established price comparison tools and trackers to determine whether the deal is actually on sale and how frequently it drops.
We also looked over customer reviews to find out what matters to real people who already own and use the deals we're recommending. Our recommendations may also be based on our own testing -- in addition to extensive research and comparison shopping. The goal is to deliver the most accurate advice to help you shop smarter.
What are the best early Black Friday deals?
ZDNET's full slate of early Black Friday coverage will be launching soon, but keep an eye out for individual offers surfaced on our site as well as opportunities to save at major retailers that may fly below the radar.
